definition: out of the ordinary
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
ordinary/commonplace/mundane/temporal/of the material world (as opposed to supernatural or immortal levels)/every/all/whatever/altogether/gist/outline/note of Chinese musical scale
echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises

sentences.english: Sometimes the simplest gesture can make a big statement.
sentences.chinese: 有時候最簡單的舉動也非同凡響。

sentences.english: The process makes the outcome seem all the more remarkable.
sentences.chinese: 製作工序使出來的成果非同凡響。

sentences.english: Its unusual colour is shared by only a handful of other plants.
sentences.chinese: 它非同凡響的色彩在其他植物中是非常稀罕的。

sentences.english: An unusual rhythm will soothe the ear.
sentences.chinese: 會有一非同凡響的節奏悅人之耳。

sentences.english: Today, we make another significant announcement.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我們發佈了一條非同凡響的通告。

definition: to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
(idiom) impossible to fault/impeccable
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
innovative/ingenious/originality/ingenuity
to be intensely proud of sth (idiom)
the eye cannot take it all in (idiom); too many good things to see/a feast for the eyes
evaluation/assessment
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
practical value
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
to be determined to win (idiom)
flawless/immaculate/perfect
inspiring/exciting/rousing
